name: Underground Night Market - UNDR GRND NGHT MRKT
description: Bringing late-night market vibes full of creative bites and emerging food and drink concepts! Enjoy a night of culinary adventure with indie vendors and live DJ sets and savour delicious, affordable eats that celebrates Toronto’s rich culinary scene. Feast on gourmet tacos, artisanal burgers, vegan and vegetarian options, plus decadent desserts and craft drinks.

name: We Walk UHNITED

location.name: 201 Elizabeth St, Toronto General Hospital outdoor parking lot

description:
UHN Foundation’s first-ever public fundraising walk — and you're invited!

Join us for a family-friendly walk through downtown Toronto in support of world-class care, research, and innovation at University Health Network (UHN). Wth an option of 5km or 2km, the accessible route passes four UHN hospitals and ends in a celebration at Toronto General Hospital with food, activities, and live entertainment by Tom Cochrane!

Walk, fundraise, and show your support for Canada’s #1 Hospital.

name: Canadian Latin Fest 2025
description:
A celebration of Latin culture, unity and diversity. This festival promises to be a dynamic cultural celebration. With over 1.8 million visitors annually, Nathan Phillips Square offers the perfect venue for this vibrant festival. It shines a spotlight on the true identity of Canadian Latin people, whose contributions to Canadian society span generations. 

Join us to celebrate the pride of Latin Canadians and their ongoing impact on the nation’s identity, emphasizing the vital role of Latin voices in shaping Canada's future. Featuring Latin multicultural food vendors, folk arts and crafts, a kids' zone, and over 20 free performances, including the popular "Let's Dance" program.

name: Discover the Splendors of Ceylon
description:
Learn all about the beautiful island of Sri Lanka! Our destination presentation will showcase the splendors of Ceylon, from its stunning beaches to its lush tea plantations. Get insider tips on the best places to visit, eat, and explore in this tropical paradise. Don't miss this opportunity to discover the magic!

Join us for a special screening of "Realm of Paradise" and let Sri Lanka enchant you.

name: Canada’s National Ballet School’s Free Summer Block Party

location.name: 400 Jarvis Street, Toronto, ON M4Y 2G6, Canada

description: Gather your family and friends and join thousands from the community to celebrate dance at Canada’s National Ballet School’s (NBS) annual Block Party! The free public event will take place at the School’s iconic campus in the heart of Toronto. Now in its fourth year, the Block Party has grown into a cornerstone of the City’s cultural calendar, offering an unparalleled entertainment experience.

name: Riverdale ArtWalk
description: Now in its 27th year, this fine art exhibition event features 165 established and emerging artists working in painting, photography, sculpture, and more. Hosted in the heart of the Queen East arts district, this outdoor festival offers a unique opportunity to connect directly with artists and purchase original work. With a relaxed park setting and a vibrant community atmosphere, it’s the perfect place to discover something new. Support local artists and bring home something truly original.

name: Scarborough 5K
description:
This event features a 5K run and a 1K Kids Run, both set against the scenic backdrop of Morningside Park.
Proceeds support the Boys & Girls Club of East Scarborough, helping us build a stronger, more connected community.

Whether you're a seasoned runner or just getting started, come be a part of this annual tradition.

Not running? We’re also looking for volunteers to help bring the day to life—cheer squads, water station crew, and more!

Register or sign up to volunteer at Race Roster, and follow @thescarborough5k on Instagram for updates.

organizer.name: Black Runners of the GTA (BRGTA) and the Canada Running Series Foundation (CRS Foundation)

name: Lauryn Hill Paint Night Workshop
description: Celebrate this legendary music artist! Listen to her greatest hits and paint her too. We’ll give you canvases with pre-drawn guidelines and you can choose your own colour story to create a unique masterpiece you can be proud of.

name: Great North Battle 2025
description:
Join us for a two day event featuring a top 16 solo beatbox battle, top eight loopstation battle, top four tag team battle plus special performances, workshops and showcases. 

Winner of the solo battle will receive a qualifying spot at the Grand Beatbox Battle 2025 hosted by Swiss Beatbox in Japan.

name: Family Nature Games Day

location.name: High Park Nature Centre Forest School

description:
Ready, set, explore! Stroll through High Park with Jen Ball (Sticks, Stones & Pinecones) to collect pinecones, pebbles, and twigs—nature’s game pieces. Then, head to OURSpace for an afternoon of playful competitions. 

From ancient classics to fresh twists, these games turn the outdoors into your very own board game café. Perfect for families with kids who love playing board games and spending time outdoors! All game pieces are natural, sustainable, and will be returned to where they were found by Nature Centre Staff to minimize our impact on the park.

name: Megan Park Tree Planting Event
description:
Join us for a morning of planting native trees and shrubs at Megan Park to help increase biodiversity and wildlife habitat!

Event site conditions vary. Contact us for more information including accessibility. If you would like to request accessibility support, contact us as soon as possible.

name: Community Environment Day at Sorauren Park
description:
Join Councillor Perks (Ward 4) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free loose compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted). Please bring a container to pick up loose compost.

name: AccessFest
description: The first-of-its-kind inclusive activity festival featuring mainstage performances by chart-topping artists, real conversations from community leaders, interactive wellness experiences, immersive art installations, local eats and more. Join us to celebrate inclusion and experience what’s possible when accessibility comes first.

name: IRC Junior Public School Fun Fair

location.name: Indian Road Crescent Junior Public School

description:
Join us for a vibrant family-friendly event open to the entire community! 

Enjoy games, inflatables, face painting, crafts, food, music, and more. Don't miss our epic raffle featuring 12 incredible and humongous themed gift baskets donated by local businesses and the school community. It's a great way to connect with neighbours and celebrate the end of the school year. Come out make memories and support our local school!

name: Resin Art Party
description:
Get creative! Use our wide variety of molds and accessories to make keychains and more, then take home your unique creation. 

This program prioritizes young adults ages 18-35.

name: Open House Event at Code Ninjas Leaside
description: Come explore how our summer camps spark creativity, build real STEM skills, and make learning seriously fun!

name: Toontease: A Cartoon Themed Burlesque Show
description:
By the power of Grayskull!  We are back and ready to deliver an action-packed, nostalgic burlesque parody of your favourite cartoon characters! It may not be Saturday morning, but you'll want to slip into your comfiest PJs and grab your favourite cereal. 

From magical girls to mutants, we’ve got something for everyone, so tune in for an unforgettable night and prepare for trouble...make it double! 

This is a 19+ event.

Accessibility:
The Main Hall is accessible with an elevator between the lower floor and the second floor of the building. Accessible washrooms are located on the lower level and the second floor. For any accessibility requests, please contact us our email.

name: Street Funky Disco Flashback Dance Party
description:
This is an ages 19 and over event. Get ready to groove, disco, brass and beyond!

Join us for a wild night of rhythm, soul, and nonstop energy. The Boom Shaka Lakas bring a full-on Disco Circus with 70s flair, roller boogie dancers, and fiery stunts. Turbo Street Funk deliver brass-rock and funk with a New Orleans twist that’ll keep you dancing all night. The Backstage Pass Band rounds out the night with a powerhouse mix of classics and modern jams. Three bands. One stage. Endless groove.

name: The Liberty Laughs Comedy Show
description:
Your favourite Bodega Comedy Show is back!

Come watch Canada's best comics bring the funny inside a unique venue tucked away in the heart of Toronto.

Featuring:
Himansu Patel
Kelly Zemnickis
Mitchell Alvis
Daniel Araya
Aaron Redublo
Headliner:
Alex Dewitt (@alexdewittcomedy | Instagram and TikTok)

Food & drinks available! Get your tickets today!
Limited seating, please arrive early.

name: Njacko Backo at The Redwood Theatre
description: Thrilled to announce the release of his 13th album entitled "Mieux Vaut Tard Que Jamais" or "Better Late Than Never".” The concert will feature opening performances from special guests Nii Osabu, Nyama Bill, and Njacko’s youngest son, Nkoni Backo. DJ Moussa will round out the evening, spinning the latest African hits and classics into the night.

name: Harbourfront Farmers Market
description: A celebration of local agriculture and fresh, homegrown produce. With a strong emphasis on “Grown Here,” this market connects visitors directly with farmers, showcasing the best in season, from farm-fresh eggs and locally-raised meats to artisanal baked goods, preserves and jams, sustainable seafood, handmade pastas and specialty coffee. Experience the freshest flavours while supporting Ontario’s hardworking farmers and small-batch producers.

name: A Year With Frog and Toad
description:
The Broadway hit! Nominated for three Tony Awards – including Best Musical.
Based on Arnold Lobel’s well-loved books and featuring a mesmerizing score by Robert and Willie Reale.
Part vaudeville, part make believe, all charm; A Year With Frog And Toad tells the story of a friendship that endures, weathering all seasons.

This jazzy, upbeat score bubbles with melody and wit, making it an inviting musical for  all ages!

Runtime: 60 - 65 mins with no intermission
Recommended Ages: 4+
Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y4Ys4Ze-px0

Photo-op with the cast after the show included with every purchase.
Please be aware reseller tickets will not be accepted.

name: West Toronto Artists Annual Art Tour
description:
The West Toronto Artists have been creating and sharing art in their community since 1998. 

Residents and visitors are welcome to experience original art by 32 local artists at 17 sites across the neighbourhoods of Bloor West, Swansea, High Park, The Junction, Roncesvalles and Runnymede, as they enjoy the fine weather and re-connect with their community.

name: The Unburdened Sessions - Live Intimate Performance with Yalene
description:
Join Yalene for an acoustic performance of her new EP Unburdened, featuring stories of healing, love, and growth. With a special opening by multidimensional artist Amana, this cozy night includes chill R&B vibes, snacks, giveaways, and a merch engraving station. Come early to connect, relax, and enjoy the candlelit, calming atmosphere. 

A night of live music that’s as unique and introspective as the artist herself.
Follow @yalenesi for updates. Sparkly nails = a free keepsake!

name: The First Quarterly - WINAIRO Conference (Women in A.I and robotics)
description:
Women who are curious about A.I. as a business tool or robotics as an academic or professional choice for their daughters or granddaughters - join us for a day filled with inspiring talks, engaging workshops, and networking opportunities. This event is dedicated to celebrating and emboldening women in this field, connect with like-minded peers, learn from industry experts, and be part of a supportive community. 

This is the first quarterly conference, with virtual conferences coming up August 30, November 29, and February 28.

Please note you don't have to be in A.I. and robotics to attend this event.
